alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 04 at 2:20AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including most of Wallowa County and eastern Union County. * WHEN...From 2 PM PDT this afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms expected to develop this afternoon over the area may produce locally heavy downpours that may result in flash flooding, especially over recent burn scars from the Double Creek and Sturgill fires. Additional showers may occur overnight Thursday through the day Friday, however these showers are not expected to be heavy as Thursday`s thunderstorms. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
